premises: If consumer confidence is low, then spending decreases
If consumer confidence is high, then investment increases
conclusions: If spending does not decrease, then consumer confidence is low
If investment does not increase, then consumer confidence is not high
If investment does not increase, then spending decreases
If consumer confidence is high and spending decreases, then investment increases
incorrect conclusions: If spending decreases, then consumer confidence is low
If spending decreases, then consumer confidence is not high
If spending does not decrease, then consumer confidence is not high
If investment increases, then consumer confidence is high
If spending decreases and investment increases, then consumer confidence is high

premises: If the unemployment rate rises, then government spending increases
If the unemployment rate falls, then consumer spending increases
conclusions: If government spending does not increase, then the unemployment rate rises
If consumer spending does not increase, then the unemployment rate does not fall
If consumer spending does not increase, then government spending increases
Government spending increases or consumer spending increases
If the unemployment rate falls and government spending increases, then consumer spending increases
incorrect conclusions: If government spending increases, then the unemployment rate rises
If government spending increases, then the unemployment rate does not fall
If government spending does not increase, then the unemployment rate does not fall
Government spending increases and consumer spending increases
If consumer spending increases, then the unemployment rate falls
If government spending increases and consumer spending increases, then the unemployment rate falls

premises: If inflation rises, then interest rates increase
If inflation falls, then unemployment decreases
conclusions: If interest rates do not increase, then inflation rises
If unemployment does not decrease, then inflation does not fall
If unemployment does not decrease, then interest rates increase
Interest rates increase or unemployment decreases
If inflation falls and interest rates increase, then unemployment decreases
incorrect conclusions: If interest rates increase, then inflation rises
If interest rates increase, then inflation does not fall
If interest rates do not increase, then inflation does not fall
Interest rates increase and unemployment decreases
If unemployment decreases, then inflation falls
If interest rates increase and unemployment decreases, then inflation falls
